com.ikaver.aagarwal.ds.hw1.processrunner

Class ProcessRunnerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • com.ikaver.aagarwal.ds.hw1.processrunner.ProcessRunnerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProcessRunner, ProcessNotificationStateHandler, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class ProcessRunnerImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements IProcessRunner, ProcessNotificationStateHandler
    Describes a process runner, an entity capable of launching, packing, unpacking and terminating processes, as well as reporting the state of the processes that its running periodically.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ProcessRunnerState getState()
      Returns the current state of the node, indicating which processes are currently running.
      boolean launch(int pid, java.lang.String classDefinition, java.lang.String[] args)
      Launches a migratable process with the given pid, serialized class definition and constructor arguments on this node.
      IMigratableProcess pack(int pid)
      Suspends the migratable process with the given pid, and afterwards returns a serialized version of the suspended process.
      boolean remove(int pid)
      Terminates the migratable process with the given pid, if its currently running on this node.
      void start()
      start() is called as soon as the user asks for this process runner to be added to the Node Manager.
      boolean unpack(int pid, IMigratableProcess process)
      Deserializes and runs the migratable process with the given pid on the current node.
      void updateProcessState(int pid, ProcessState state)
      Updates the state of the process with given pid

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        start() is called as soon as the user asks for this process runner to be added to the Node Manager. This should clear the state of the process runner before returning.
        Specified by:
        start in interface IProcessRunner
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

        Returns the current state of the node, indicating which processes are currently running.

        Returns:

      • pack

        public IMigratableProcess pack(int pid)
        Suspends the migratable process with the given pid, and afterwards returns a serialized version of the suspended process.
        Specified by:
        pack in interface IProcessRunner
        Parameters:
        pid - The process pid
        Returns:
        A serialized version of the suspended process with the given pid.
        See Also:

      • unpack

        public boolean unpack(int pid,
             IMigratableProcess process)
        Deserializes and runs the migratable process with the given pid on the current node.
        Specified by:
        unpack in interface IProcessRunner
        Parameters:
        pid - The process pid
        serializedProcess - A serialized version of the process that represents its current state.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(int pid)
        Terminates the migratable process with the given pid, if its currently running on this node.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface IProcessRunner
        Parameters:
        pid - The process pid
        Returns:
        true iff a process with the given pid was successfully terminated.

      • launch

        public boolean launch(int pid,
             java.lang.String classDefinition,
             java.lang.String[] args)
        Launches a migratable process with the given pid, serialized class definition and constructor arguments on this node.
        Specified by:
        launch in interface IProcessRunner
        Parameters:
        pid - The id that will be assigned to this process
        classDefinition - The serialized class definition of the migratable process
        args - The arguments with which the constructor will be invoked
        Returns:
        true iff the process was launched successfully
